resources.string: Choose an app to launch with a swipe up.

The button in this app functions as a virtual "back" button, simulating the action of a physical back button on your device. When pressed, it uses the Accessibility Service to send a command that mimics the back action, allowing you to navigate to the previous screen or close the current app. This can be especially useful on devices without dedicated navigation buttons, providing a quick and convenient way to move back without needing to reach for the on-screen navigation bar. For this feature to work, you\'ll need to enable the app\'s Accessibility Service in the device settings.
To function properly, the app needs accessibility permission. \nOnce granted you must reopen the application.
To function properly, the app needs permission to draw on top of other apps. \nOnce granted you must reopen the application.
Hide the floating back button, useful for car servicing (this is hidden by default)
Help: Swipe up here to go back (this simulate the physical back button)
Help: Swipe up here to open selected app
